subject: History
title: Cuban Missile Crisis Intelligence
description: A short lesson to help you apply Cuban Missile Crisis Intelligence.

hook.text: In October 1962, spy photos of Cuba brought the world closer to nuclear war than it has ever been.

buildup.text: A U-2 flight over Cuba photographed Soviet nuclear missile sites under construction, just 90 miles from Florida.

discovery.text: CIA photo analysts identified medium-range ballistic missiles capable of reaching Washington in 13 minutes.

twist.text: Soviet spy Oleg Penkovsky had secretly given the CIA the technical manuals for those exact missiles months before.

climax.text: Kennedy's blockade worked. Khrushchev withdrew the missiles. Penkovsky was later caught and executed.

punchline.text: A dead spy's documents helped prevent nuclear war.

quiz.question: How did Oleg Penkovsky help the US during the Cuban Missile Crisis?
options: He sabotaged the missile sites in Cuba
He had secretly given the CIA Soviet missile technical manuals
He convinced Khrushchev to withdraw the missiles
